failure_groups.name: Template Misuse
failure_groups.description: Incorrect, unsafe, or invalid use of Jinja templating within Home Assistant configuration.

failure_groups.name: Entity Hallucination
failure_groups.description: Reference to Home Assistant entities, services, or states that do not exist or are fabricated.
examples: light.kitchen_ceiling_2 when no such entity exists

failure_groups.name: Unsupported HA Syntax
failure_groups.description: Use of YAML keys, integrations, or configuration structures not supported by the current HA version.

failure_groups.name: Unsafe YAML Mutation
failure_groups.description: Modification of YAML in a way that may break configuration, remove required fields, or introduce instability.
examples: Altering indentation leading to invalid YAML

failure_groups.name: Unscoped State Access
failure_groups.description: Accessing global states or entities without proper scoping or validation.
examples: Assuming entity availability without guard conditions

failure_groups.name: Silent Destructive Suggestion
failure_groups.description: Recommending deletion, overwrite, or reset operations without warning or backup guidance.
examples: Deleting entire configuration sections without warning
Overwriting configuration files without preserving originals

failure_groups.name: Failure to Acknowledge Ambiguity
failure_groups.description: Providing deterministic configuration changes when the input is ambiguous or incomplete.

failure_groups.name: Template Trigger Misplacement
failure_groups.description: Embedding complex Jinja logic inside a state trigger instead of using a template trigger.

failure_groups.name: Legacy Service Key Usage
failure_groups.description: Use of deprecated 'service:' key instead of 'action:' in automations.

failure_groups.name: Targeting Ambiguity
failure_groups.description: Using broad area targeting when more specific label or floor targeting is appropriate without clarification.

failure_groups.name: Recursive Automation Loop
failure_groups.description: Automation modifies the same entity that triggers it without guard conditions to prevent infinite loops.
